Package net.happybrackets.core.control

Class TriggerControl

java.lang.Object
net.happybrackets.core.control.DynamicControlParent
net.happybrackets.core.control.TriggerControl
Direct Known Subclasses:
TriggerControlSender
public abstract class TriggerControl
extends DynamicControlParent
This class encapsulates the functionality of DynamicControl classes of type ControlType.TRIGGER in a simple API. Trigger controls do not have an internal value.

All TriggerControl controls with the same name and ControlScope will respond to a message send(). For example, consider two TriggerControl objects with the same ControlScope and name. 
    TriggerControl control1 = new TriggerControlSender(this, "Send");

    TriggerControl control2 = new TriggerControl(this, "Send") {
        @Override
        public void triggerEvent() {
            System.out.println("Received Trigger");
        }
    };

    control1.send();
This will cause the triggerEvent() function to be called, causing Received Trigger to be printed to standard output

The control can also schedule trigger messages to be sent at a time in the future by adding the scheduled time to the message send(double) function. Eg

control1.send (HB.getSchedulerTime() + 1000); // this will trigger control1 value, as well as all other TriggerControls with same ControlScope and name, 1 second in the future.

Triggering an event within the HappyBrackets control display is effected by clicking the button associated with the control If you do not require a handler on the class, use the TriggerControlSender class

  • Constructor Details

    • TriggerControl

      public TriggerControl​(java.lang.Object parent_sketch, java.lang.String name)
      Create a Trigger Dynamic Control
      Parameters:
      parent_sketch - The parent object for control
      name - the name to display

  • Method Details

    • send

      public void send()
      Send a trigger event. This will pass the message on to all other DynamicControl with matching name, type and ControlScope and call triggerEvent(). 
           TriggerControl control1 = new TriggerControlSender(this, "Send");

     TriggerControl control2 = new TriggerControl(this, "Send") {
        @Override
        public void triggerEvent() {
            System.out.println("Received Trigger");
        }
     };

     control1.send();
      This will cause the triggerEvent() function to be called, causing Received Trigger to be printed to standard output

    • send

      public void send​(double scheduler_time)
      Send a trigger event at a specific time. Identical to the send() with the exception that the triggerEvent() event will be caused at the HBScheduler scheduled time passed in. For example: 
           TriggerControl control1 = new TriggerControlSender(this, "Send");

     TriggerControl control2 = new TriggerControl(this, "Send") {
        @Override
        public void triggerEvent() {
            System.out.println("Received Trigger");
        }
     };
     control1.send (HB.getSchedulerTime() + 1000); // this will trigger control1 value, as well as all other TriggerControls with same ControlScope and name, 1 second in the future.
      Parameters:
      scheduler_time - the scheduler time this is supposed to occur at

    • triggerEvent

      public abstract void triggerEvent()
      Triggered events are received through this function after calling send() on the object. For example: 
          TriggerControl control1 = new TriggerControlSender(this, "Send");

    TriggerControl control2 = new TriggerControl(this, "Send") {
        @Override
            public void triggerEvent() {
            System.out.println("Received Trigger");
        }
    };
     control1.send();

    • setControlScope

      public TriggerControl setControlScope​(ControlScope new_scope)
      Changed the scope that the control has. It will update control map so the correct events will be generated based on its scope We must do this in subclass
      Overrides:
      setControlScope in class DynamicControlParent
      Parameters:
      new_scope - The new Control Scope
      Returns:
      this object

    • setDisplayType

      public TriggerControl setDisplayType​(DynamicControl.DISPLAY_TYPE display_type)
      Change how to display object as DynamicControl.DISPLAY_TYPE We must do this in subclass
      Parameters:
      display_type - The new display type
      Returns:
      this object
